content.question: Three resistors of resistance <math alttext="8.0 ohms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>8</mn><mtext>.</mtext><mn>0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>Ω</mtext></math>, <math alttext="12 ohms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>12</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>Ω</mtext></math>, and <math alttext="24 ohms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>24</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>Ω</mtext></math> are connected in parallel to a battery. The current through the battery is <math alttext="20 amperes" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>20</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. What is the potential difference across this combination of resistors?

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
